name.baseName: Neodymium fluoride production|Neodymium fluoride|Molten salt electrolysis (blue)|Neodymium iron boron (NdFeB) magnet
氟化钕生产|氟化钕|熔盐电解（蓝色）|钕铁硼（NdFeB）磁铁

quantitativeReference.functionalUnitOrOther: 1 kg of Nd was chosen as the functional unit of the process (FUP)

technology.technologyDescriptionAndIncludedProcesse: 中国白云鄂博高度简化的工艺链基于混合氟碳铈矿/独居石原矿。原矿石通过露天开采过程开采。稀土金属可以使用不同的金属精炼工艺从 REO 中加工而成，例如钙金属热还原或电解工艺。金属热还原必须以间歇模式进行，并且由于需要高温而非常耗能。与金属热还原相比，MSE消耗的能量更少，并且可以作为连续过程进行。

The highly simplified process chain for Bayan Obo in China based on a mixed bastnaesite/monazite raw ore. The raw ore is mined in an open pit mining process. RE metals can be processed from REOs using different metal refining processes like metallothermic reduction with calcium or electrolysis processes. Metallothermic reduction must be performed in a batch mode and is very energy intensive due to the high temperatures required. Compared with the metallothermic reduction, MSE consumes less energy and can be conducted as a continuous process.

LCIMethodAndAllocation.deviationsFromLCIMethodApproaches: The reason for this was the economic-based allocation method used, which was based on different production baskets (various metals) of the facilities. By allocating the single-output Nd2O3 MSE process with respect to price for all products of the entire facility, the environmental life cycle impacts of Nd differed. In case Nd was produced in a facility along with REEs of high economic value, Nd’s environmental impact was lower than in case REEs of lower economic value were produced along with Nd. This made no sense as, in fact, Nd2O3 MSE was no multioutput process, and thus Nd production had a certain environmental impact regardless of other REEs’ economic value.

referenceToDataSource.common:shortDescription: Schreiber, A., Marx, J., Zapp, P. & Kuckshinrichs, W. Comparative Life Cycle Assessment of Neodymium Oxide Electrolysis in Molten Salt. Adv. Eng. Mater. 22, 1901206 (2020).
Schreiber, A., Marx, J., Zapp, P. & Kuckshinrichs, W. Comparative Life Cycle Assessment of Neodymium Oxide Electrolysis in Molten Salt. Adv. Eng. Mater. 22, 1901206 (2020).
